SENT.plain: 147 patients with myelodysplastic syndromes were investigated for the presence of micronuclei and nuclear budding in bone marrow erythroblasts
The patients were divided into subgroups on the basis of bone marrow karyotype, 31 healthy bone marrow donors constituted a control group
Patients with monosomy 7 or 7q- and patients with major karyotypic abnormalities (MAKA) had significantly more erythroblasts with micronuclei and nuclear budding than the control group
Patients with a 5q- chromosome as the sole karyotypic aberration had more micronuclei than the controls
For other patients with MDS the differences were statistically nonsignificant
